ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.2_0: the monks from the group of six had beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.3_0: People who were walking about the dwellings saw this, and they complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics act like this? They are just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.5_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.7_0: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.11_0: “... Foolish men, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.13_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.14.1_0: ‘If a monk beds or benches made up a bed or bench, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.6_0: there are four kinds of beds: one with legs and frame, called _masāraka_; one with legs and frame, called _bundikābaddha_; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.8_0: there are four kinds of benches: one with legs and frame, called _masāraka_; one with legs and frame, called _bundikābaddha_; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.10_0: there are three kinds of cotton down: cotton down from trees, cotton down from creepers, cotton down from grass.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.12_0: if he makes one or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.13_0: When he obtains it, it is to be destroyed, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.14.1_0: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.15_0: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.16_0: If she finishes herself what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.17_0: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.18_0: If he makes one, or has one made, for someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.19_0: If she obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.3_0: if it is for a belt;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.4_0: if it is for a shoulder strap;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.5_0: if it is for a bowl bag;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.6_0: in the forest, free from birth,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.7_0: if he is making a pillow;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.8_0: if he obtains what was made by another and then uses it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.10_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.11_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on upholstered with cotton down, is finished.
